message.content:
Here is a healthy meal plan for the week that excludes dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, and cashews:

Monday:

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with sliced banana and a drizzle of maple syrup
* Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and balsamic vinaigrette dressing
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted sweet potato and steamed broccoli

Tuesday:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach, mushrooms, and whole wheat toast
* Lunch: Turkey and avocado wrap with mixed greens and hummus sauce
* Dinner: Stir-fried vegetables (such as bell peppers, carrots, and broccoli) with tofu and brown rice

Wednesday:

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt with sliced berries and a sprinkle of granola
* Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with mixed greens salad and a lemon vinaigrette dressing
* Dinner: Slow cooker lentil soup with kale and quinoa

Thursday:

* Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with frozen berries, banana, spinach, and almond milk topped with sliced almonds and chia seeds
* Lunch: Tuna salad sandwich on whole wheat bread with mixed greens and a side of carrot sticks
* Dinner: Grilled shrimp skewers with roasted vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, and onions) and quinoa

Friday:

* Breakfast: Omelette with mushrooms, spinach, and whole wheat toast
* Lunch: Grilled chicken Caesar salad with romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and a homemade Caesar dressing made with olive oil and lemon juice
* Dinner: Baked cod with roasted asparagus and brown rice

Saturday:

* Breakfast: Avocado toast on whole wheat bread with a fried egg and cherry tomatoes
* Lunch: Chicken and vegetable stir-fry with brown rice
* Dinner: Grilled steak with roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potato

Sunday:

* Breakfast: Breakfast burrito with scrambled eggs, black beans, and avocado wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla
* Lunch: Tuna salad sandwich on whole wheat bread with mixed greens and a side of carrot sticks
* Dinner: Baked chicken breast with roasted vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and Brussels sprouts) and quinoa

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day. Also, feel free to adjust the portion sizes based on your individual calorie needs.
